definition:
The [*Smarandache Notions Journal*]{} is a publication devoted to
Florentin Smarandache’s ideas about number theory and physics.
Originally called the [*Smarandache Function Journal*]{} (as it focused
on the Smarandache function), it changed to a more general title with
Volume 7 and began to cover other mathematical topics studied by
Smarandache. The editorial board of the journal consists mainly of
Romanian mathematicians but Smarandache himself is excluded.
Contributors to Volume 7 include Henry Ibstedt, Florian Luca, and Y. V.
Chebrakov.

Although it is available in hard copy, most libraries don’t carry it.
The official home page does not make the journal navigable by issue
number. The journal is occasionally cited by Mathworld, mainly in
connection to consecutive numbers.
